title: Ranked Queue
body: The AFK check is not popping up, only in Ranked queue, and now I am unable to queue up for matches because I missed too many? I restarted everything and it only popped up one time after the restart,someone didnt accept, and the next time it never showed it just kicked me back to queue up lobby without popping up. Anyone else having this for only ranked queue?

replies.body:
When this happens, it's usually caused by your client having a poor connection to the PvP.net service, which gives you queue pops and communicates your actions to the matchmaking platform. Any sort of draft mode especially requires a steady connection and local network settings are often the cause of such issues. I strongly recommend working through our [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) as a first step toward resolving this.

Let me know if you continue to have this issue after completing that guide.

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=shyAsJOO,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-10-06T16:46:15.575+0000)
>
> When this happens, it's usually caused by your client having a poor connection to the PvP.net service, which gives you queue pops and communicates your actions to the matchmaking platform. Any sort of draft mode especially requires a steady connection and local network settings are often the cause of such issues. I strongly recommend working through our [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) as a first step toward resolving this.
> 
> Let me know if you continue to have this issue after completing that guide.

I've already done everything in the connection guide because I've had problems in the past between my ISP and your servers preventing me to play for almost a week(which were resolved). It just randomly happens and just doesn't work for a while. I am able to watch Twitch on Source  ,1080P youtube, or play any game with my standard ping during this time but when it comes to League it randomly sucks at connecting.

I dont know what it is, but it gives me a lot of unnecessary leaverbusters/afk check punishments. Also it ALWAYS happens during atleast one of my promo games which gives me an auto loss so I just play normals and no ranked usually.

Since your primarily having issues with League and this has happened in the past, as you've stated, this is likely another issue with your routing to the server. I recommend running a traceroute log so we can take a look at where this issue is happening along your route. I recommend doing this with a network app called [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/). After starting up the program, plug in **104.160.131.1** for the host/focus address then start the trace. After it's run for 5 minutes, export the results as text and paste them here in a reply.

Let me know if you run into any issues with doing this.

Host                                                         % | Sent | Recv | Best | Avrg | Wrst | Last |
10.0.0.1 -                                                      0 |  267 |  267 |    2 |    3 |   15 |    4 |
 tx-71-54-120-1.dhcp.embarqhsd.net -      0 |  265 |  265 |   15 |   72 | 1377 |   18 |
klln-agw1.inet.qwest.net -                          0 |  266 |  266 |   16 |   73 | 1377 |   17 |
atx-edge-05.inet.qwest.net -                      0 |  265 |  265 |   44 |   99 | 1408 |   45 |
65.124.97.62 -                                            0 |  265 |  265 |   43 |   99 | 1408 |   45 |
104.160.135.35 -                                        0 |  265 |  265 |   43 |   98 | 1407 |   45 |
 ae32-br02.chi01.riotdirect.net -              0 |  265 |  265 |   57 |  112 | 1426 |   60 |
ae1-br01.chi01.riotdirect.net -                  0 |  265 |  265 |   57 |  112 | 1424 |   58 |
104.160.131.1 -                                          0 |  265 |  265 |   58 |  111 | 1423 |   59 |
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This is kind of an accurate representation,in a sense, that if I manage to get into a draft/ranked game of any sorts I usually cant do it again for a while. There is nothing going on in my network at this time and my internet is running at the speed I pay for which is more than enough for gaming. 

I've experienced the Ranked/Draft afk checker not appearing since the patch Ivern was released and I use to have 45-50 constant ms before the server move to Chicago, I think it was, and now get a block at 65 and cant go any lower since then. Ever since my MS changed from 45/50 to 65 I  have experienced more lag spikes and unreliable connections to league servers day to day. One day I will have 65 ms and play with my friends who have the same connection, rural area with only one ISP, and other days we will all be at a constant 120+ for ONLY league.

Back when we dealing with this - [Forum Post on LoLBoards](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/B2VFcQKX-stuck-at-logging-in-after-maintenance?show=flat) -
I contacted my ISP about it and I spent some money on new hardware, powerline for my computer instead of using wireless, and I got any upgrades that were able to be offered at the time. Granted I now, shockingly, get what I actually pay for it has made no improvement between Centurylink and Riot Servers.

Your traceroute show some huge latency spikes along your entire route before you hit the servers. It all starts with the first hop outside of your network at this node: **tx-71-54-120-1.dhcp.embarqhsd.net**

Since these issues happen across the entire spectrum of CenturyLink's network before hitting our servers, I recommend reaching out to their tier 2 tech support and provide this traceroute so they can start an investigation.

Let me know if you have any questions.

They told me that its recommended to buy their 20-40Mb services to be able to online game without issues. I told them 10mb is the maximum they provide in my area and he said there is nothing to do and I have to buy a more expensive plan when its available and that was it. Thanks for the help though Targon!

I'm not sure you were provided with correct information. Connection downlink speed does not directly affect your routing to a server, and in this situation, I feel there could be more investigation done from their end. I strongly recommend getting back in contact with them and asking to be escalated to a higher tier of support. At some point, you should reach someone who can use the data in your traceroute to resolve the issue.

Let me know if you have any other questions.
